title: Facebook Conversion Event Mixin
description: The Conversions API allows advertisers to send web events from their servers directly to Facebook. Server events are linked to a pixel and are processed like browser pixel events. This means that server events are used in measurement, reporting, and optimization in the same way as browser pixel events.

productListItems.title: Product list items
productListItems.description: A list of items representing a product selected by a customer with specific options and pricing that are for that usage context at a specific point of time and may differ from the product record.

commerce.title: Commerce
commerce.description: Commerce specific data related to this event.

contentCategory.title: Facebook Content Category
contentCategory.description: The category of the content associated with the event.

contentType.title: Facebook Content Type
contentType.description: It should be set to product or product_group.Use product, if the keys you send represent products. Sent keys could be content_ids or contents.Use product_group, if the keys you send in content_ids represent product groups. Product groups are used to distinguish products that are identical but have variations such as color, material, size or pattern.

numItems.title: Number Of Items in Cart
numItems.description: Use only with InitiateCheckout events. The number of items that a user tries to buy during checkout.

deliveryCategory.title: Delivery Category
deliveryCategory.description: Type of delivery for a purchase event. Supported values are.

status.title: Registration Event Status
status.description: Use only with CompleteRegistration events. The status of the registration event.

value.title: Value
value.description: A numeric value associated with this event. This could be a monetary value or a value in some other metric.

fbp.title: Facebook Conversion Browser Id
fbp.description: When the Facebook pixel is installed on a website, and the pixel uses first-party cookies, the pixel automatically saves a unique identifier to an _fbp cookie for the website domain if one does not already exist. The fbp event parameter value must be of the form version.subdomainIndex.creationTime.randomnumber.

fbc.title: Facebook Conversion Click Id
fbc.description: When a user clicks on an ad on Facebook, the link sometimes includes a fbclid query parameter. When the user lands on the target website, if the website has a Facebook pixel that uses first-party cookies, the pixel automatically saves the fbclid query parameter to an _fbc cookie for that website domain. The fbc event parameter value must be of the form version.subdomainIndex.creationTime.fbclid

predicted_ltv.title: Predicted Lifetime Value
predicted_ltv.description: The predicted lifetime value of a conversion event.
